intro: Podandra pilosa, commonly known as the hairy podandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Podandra pilosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
